page.title: 06HYDRO BOARD,NOSTIE LOCHALSH
page.content: In the Lochalsh area most of the electricity is produced from water. There is a reservoir at the top of the hill.The water runs down steel pipes into the power station where it turns a turbine.This turbine drives a generator which produces the electricity.However the power station at Nostie does not produce enough electricity for our area.Electricity at peak periods has to come from stations elsewhere.Although the water is free,electricty charges are just slightly lower than in the rest of Britain because of the hydro station. In winter there are many problems maintaining the over head lines because of the high winds,snow and electrical storms.In these conditions it is difficult to even reach the lines.There are less than 1% of the homes in the area without electricity.
